### Describe the bug

Cython 3.1.0 fails to compile extensions targeting PyPy 3.8 due to use of the `PyObject_Vectorcall` function. This function is [only available](https://doc.pypy.org/en/latest/release-v7.3.10.html#python-3-9-c-api) starting from PyPy 3.9, which leads to build errors when compiling under PyPy 3.8 or earlier.

### Code to reproduce the behaviour:

Here is an example backtrace:
```
gcc -pthread -DNDEBUG -O2 -fPIC -arch arm64 -I/Users/runner/work/cvc5/cvc5/install/include -I/private/var/folders/w5/_8wgjw3j5cg6mgrth3s2kg9m0000gn/T/cibw-run-d0n1i_xr/pp38-macosx_arm64/build/venv/include -I/Users/runner/Library/Caches/cibuildwheel/pypy3.8-v7.3.11-macos_arm64/include/pypy3.8 -c cvc5_python_base.cpp -o build/temp.macosx-11.0-arm64-pypy38/cvc5_python_base.o -std=c++17 -fno-var-tracking
cvc5_python_base.cpp:113585:5: error: no matching function for call to '_PyPyObject_Vectorcall'
    _PyObject_Vectorcall
    ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
/Users/runner/Library/Caches/cibuildwheel/pypy3.8-v7.3.11-macos_arm64/include/pypy3.8/pypy_decl.h:1138:30: note: expanded from macro '_PyObject_Vectorcall'
#define _PyObject_Vectorcall _PyPyObject_Vectorcall
                                ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
/Users/runner/Library/Caches/cibuildwheel/pypy3.8-v7.3.11-macos_arm64/include/pypy3.8/pypy_decl.h:1139:30: note: candidate function not viable: 2nd argument ('PyObject *const *' (aka '_object *const *')) would lose const qualifier
PyAPI_FUNC(struct _object *) _PyObject_Vectorcall(struct _object *arg0, struct _object **arg1, Signed arg2, struct _object *arg3);
                                ^
/Users/runner/Library/Caches/cibuildwheel/pypy3.8-v7.3.11-macos_arm64/include/pypy3.8/pypy_decl.h:1138:30: note: expanded from macro '_PyObject_Vectorcall'
#define _PyObject_Vectorcall _PyPyObject_Vectorcall
                                ^
cvc5_python_base.cpp:113904:19: error: use of undeclared identifier 'PyArg_ValidateKeywordArguments'
    if (unlikely(!PyArg_ValidateKeywordArguments(kwds))) return -1;
                    ^
cvc5_python_base.cpp:113952:19: error: use of undeclared identifier 'PyArg_ValidateKeywordArguments'
    if (unlikely(!PyArg_ValidateKeywordArguments(kwds))) return -1;
                    ^
cvc5_python_base.cpp:114260:23: error: use of undeclared identifier 'PyArg_ValidateKeywordArguments'
        if (unlikely(!PyArg_ValidateKeywordArguments(kwds))) return;
                        ^
4 errors generated.
```

### Expected behaviour

Cython should detect the Python implementation version (or specifically, the availability of the `PyObject_Vectorcall` function) and avoid using it when targeting interpreters that do not support it, such as PyPy 3.8.

### OS

Linux

### Python version

3.8

### Cython version

3.1.0

### Additional context

_No response_

comment_data.body:
Is there a reason why you still need to support PyPy3. 8? It seems to be long out of maintenance, so while we could try to keep it working, I wonder if it's worth doing.

Specifically, the last commit in their 3.8 branch was in January 2023:
https://foss.heptapod.net/pypy/pypy/-/commits/branch/py3.8?ref_type=heads
